visuals.title: Continuous-Time Signal x(t)
visuals.description: A continuous signal is defined for every value of time t. The signal x(t) can be measured at any instant.

visuals.title: Discrete-Time Signal x[n]
visuals.description: A discrete signal x[n] exists only at integer sample indices n. Between samples, the signal is undefined.

visuals.title: Sampling & Aliasing Demo
visuals.description: Adjust the sampling rate to see aliasing in action. When fs < 2f (Nyquist rate), the reconstructed signal is distorted.
